pullRequest.title: Add nil literal support

commit.message:
Merge branch 'incremental-parser' of https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-lang into nil-literal-support

 Conflicts:
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/internal/parser/BallerinaParser.java
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/internal/parser/BallerinaParserErrorHandler.java

nodes.bodyText: We would not need the switch-case and the recovery, since this is already validated, before coming here.
In the null case, we can simply return the token.. similar to string-literal/int-literal

Don't need to handle () in basic literals.. It was added to deal with literals with a single token. So may be we could only handle null here.
For () lets use NIL_LITERAL and add it to the EXPRESSIONS alternatives array.
Eventhough the endContext() is called here, startContext() is not called at the first switch-case of getNextRule() method for NIL_LITERAL.

A context is not started for null keyword.. So ending the context here is not correct.
We might not need any context for null keyword at all. It is very similar to string literal, int literal etc. A context is needed when a token can occur in different contexts/places  and if we can't determine whats next rule should be.. Then we make use of the parent context.
Use NilLiteralNode as per the new convention

nodes.bodyText: Shall we add some more tests, to validate the usages of nil-literal (()), such as var-decl, defaultable-params, in object/record fields, etc?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,39 @@

+package io.ballerinalang.compiler.parser.test.syntax.expressions;
+
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+/**
+ * Test parsing nil literal.
+ */
+public class NilLiteralTest extends AbstractExpressionsTest {
+
+    // Valid source tests
+
+    @Test
+    public void testSimpleNilLiteral() {
+        test("()", "basic-literals/nil_literal_assert_01.json");
+        test("null", "basic-literals/nil_literal_assert_02.json");
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testNilLiteral() {
+        test("() != null + a", "basic-literals/nil_literal_assert_03.json");
+    }
+}
